Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a fill or kill order wont stay active very long

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So it is not fill or kill?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is, but it is given one minute to fill

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no central ordermatch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need to understand a fully decentralized orderbook cant work exactly like a centralized ordermatch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the orderbook actually doesnt exist in any single place. each node constructs its own version of the orderbook

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I understand.

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I am just a little confused, because fill or kill has a very specific meaning--`buy` seems more like good-till-time, with time being a minute

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well the effect is that it is filled or killed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one minute is the typical blocktime

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is an "instant"

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So can an alice leave an order open on the order book?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not really, but alice can do a "gtc" order, which is simulated by submitting the same order over and over

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and once any part of it fills, it is considered done

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i know, i know, not what its supposed to be

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: What about `bot_buy`/ `bot_sell`?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: those arent really needed anymore

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it issues a stream of orders until it is done, or has 10 attempts

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Oh ok

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Making sure I understand this, bob can leave orders open on the book with `setprice` and `autoprice`?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: bob responds to alice requests

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so bob "leaves orders" open, but it is a realtime auction between all the bobs for each alice request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it isnt actually any normal orderbook

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the orderbook is a fiction, an illusion

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok, that makes more sense

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: try not to be so literal about the terms used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alternative was to use totally new and unfamiliar language for concepts that are similar

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: That's fair

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: But I mean, from what you guys told me, `dump` and `fomo` match the definition of a market order

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but for crypto people, it has meaning

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you are free to rename things to whatever you want though, it is just the internal docs

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Does every order have a uuid?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Where is it created? LP_autobuy? Also, is the uuid for each order stored anywhere?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the swapfiles are stored in `~/SuperNET/iguana/DB/SWAPS/`

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Does that include data about orders? Or just swaps?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: both

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: few different files gets created for a single swap. they contain all the information

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I'm asking about orders not swaps

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Can there be only one swap per order?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: are you talking about alice of bob order?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Bob

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: there can be multiple swap per order. that depends on the amount of utxos bob has

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So is there a uuid for bob orders? And is there one for alice orders?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: for a swap it is same `uuid`, `quoteid` & `requestid` that bob and alice gets

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I'm asking about orders not swaps

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: orders doesn't have uuid

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok thanks

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Can bobs use the "buy" and "sell" RPC methods?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no, using buy and sell make you alice

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Thanks @jl777c

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: @jl777c I asked someone else this earlier but wanted to be sure: Orders do not have UUIDs, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well, a uuid is created when alice creates the order, but like one hand clapping, without bob answering it, did it really exist?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So they do have UUIDs?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: If so, is that the UUID created in `LP_autobuy` here: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/KomodoPlatform/blob/master/iguana/exchanges/LP_ordermatch.c#L1828? @jl777c

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, also the caller can set a uuid

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Thanks--I spent a little too long trying to figure out if that was the uuid for a swap or the order

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Are the uuid's stored anywhere?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: For bob (and maybe alice too)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it ends up in the json for the swap request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which then ends up in DB/SWAPS

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Is that under the "uuid" key?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what else could that be

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i try to make things clear

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I thought it might have been the uuid for the swap

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So multiple swaps for the same order can have the same uuid, right?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no, each swap is unique

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there can be multiple proposed swaps for a single request, they would all have the same uuid, but only one can actually happen

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: An alice can't do two swaps with two different bobs for one order?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: (One swap each)

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: 1 order = 1 swap

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: 2 orders = 2 swaps

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: @SHossain But I thought you said "there can be multiple swap per order. that depends on the amount of utxos bob has"

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: that is for bob.

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Oh ok.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: bob puts one order using `autoprice` or `setprice` and has multiple utxo. alice can keep swapping their coin that matches with utxo. it can be any number of swaps before bob finishes his sell.

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok, thanks. To clarify, when @jl777c said "there can be multiple proposed swaps for a single request, they would all have the same uuid, but only one can actually happen," what is the "request"?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alice posts a buy/sell trade request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: bob(s) respond

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alice picks the one she likes best

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: swap starts

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Thanks. So,  if "alice keeps swapping their coin that matches with" the "best" bob's utxo, is there one or multiple swaps?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think you are not understanding what a swap is...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is for specific utxo for another specific utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you cant double spend the same utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: alice can only swap her specific utxo once, with one bob, no more

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Sorry, I understand. I was confused because @SHossain said " it can be any number of swaps before bob finishes his sell" but now realize he meant multiple swaps before bob finishes, not multiple swaps before alice finishes

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: To clarify, if alice places an order, only one swap can result from it?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
it is for specific utxo for another specific utxo
you cant double spend the same utxo
alice can only swap her specific utxo once, with one bob, no more

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: What is "it"? A swap or an order?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: both

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: an order from alice specifies the utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a swap based on the order, uses the same utxi

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you seem to get hung up on some specific words

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok. So all of bob's swaps are in iguana/DB/SWAPS, right?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: yes

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: same for alice
